image.altText: A long line of cows lined up in the countryside on a farm.

props.synopsis: Residents say a "corrosive" trend to sell fertile farmland to make way for foreign-owned wood plantations is ruining communities and threatening Australia's food security.

title.children: Why farms in Australia's most valuable dairy region are being sold to foreign timber companies

image.altText: Bruce Lehrmann walks into court.

props.synopsis: The former Liberal staffer has been given extra time to file amended grounds of appeal, as he seeks to overturn the result of his failed defamation case.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann's lawyer defends missed deadlines in attempt to overturn defamation ruling

image.altText: Anthony Albanese Chris Minns Jacinta Allan, prime minister in focus.

props.synopsis: The federal government calls on the states and territories to step up efforts to reduce domestic, sexual and family violence, ahead of more funds being delivered to address the issue.

title.children: Federal government calls out states for missed DV staffing targets ahead of anticipated $351m support package

image.altText: An out of focus photo of a woman in a black jacket sitting on a bench with a multi-coloured wall behind her in focus.

props.synopsis: Documents reveal personal health data on Victoria's donor registry has been at extreme risk of being lost, hacked, or changed for more than a year due to poor data security.

title.children: Information about Steph's biological heritage is contained in Victoria's donor database. Now there are fears it's not secure

image.altText: Swans and Giants fans with an afl ball between them

props.synopsis: Melbourne has tightly held the rights to hosting the AFL Grand Final for almost every year since the code began. NSW Premier Chris Minns says "let's take it off them".

title.children: 'Home ground advantage' isn't just sporting superstition. Is it time the AFL even the playing field?

image.altText: Kim Woo-min at the medal ceremony alongside Elijah Winnington

props.synopsis: Michael Palfrey has been given his marching orders over controversial comments made ahead of the men's 400m freestyle event at the Paris Olympics.

title.children: Swimming Australia sacks coach Michael Palfrey over 'Go Korea' comment at Olympics

image.altText: Vanessa Low of Australia in action, competing in the long jump at the Paris Paralympics

props.synopsis: Defending champion Vanessa Low has broken her own world record with the first jump of the women's long jump T63 final, becoming one of four medallists for Australia on day eight of the Paralympics.

title.children: Low breaks world record to claim long jump title, Hodge and Parker win gold medals for Australia

image.altText: Hands hold up a gold, silver and bronze medal

props.synopsis: Keep up with how many medals Aussie athletes won overnight — and where Australia sits on the leaderboard.

title.children: Here are the medal standings after day eight of the Paralympic Games

image.altText: A man standing at a lectern, spreading his arms and shrugging.

props.synopsis: Bill Shorten has had an enormous impact on the NDIS. When he leaves parliament next year, there will be no shortage of challenges for whoever steps in as minister, write Nas Campanella and Evan Young.

title.children: Bill Shorten is leaving politics. The next NDIS minister better be ready to roll up their sleeves

image.altText: A man at a cash register.

props.synopsis: With freight adding up to 50 per cent to their cost of living, Lord Howe Islanders find ways to manage the price of living in paradise.

title.children: With petrol $4 a litre and rice $9 a kilo, Lord Howe island residents get creative to keep costs down

image.altText: A woman hold a photo of her son.

props.synopsis: The governor-general will soon receive the final report of the Royal Commission into Defence and Veterans Suicide. Grieving families are hoping it will lead to lasting change.

title.children: '3,000 veterans dead': This grieving mother has led the fight for all of them

image.altText: Rescue divers in fluro suits stand on the step of a boat with a green bodybag at their feet

props.synopsis: Autopsies of four of the seven victims indicate they died from a lack of oxygen while trapped in cabins on the luxury superyacht.

title.children: Bayesian yacht victims suffocated, autopsies suggest

image.altText: Two samples of fluoride salt as a solid and as a liquid.

props.synopsis: China plans to build the world's first-ever nuclear power station using molten salt as the fuel carrier and coolant, and thorium as the fuel — revealed in a since-deleted report posted on the Shanghai Institute of Applied Physics website.

title.children: China to build first-ever thorium molten salt nuclear power station in Gobi Desert

image.altText: The Pope holding a paper while sitting on a chair next to the Indonesian president

props.synopsis: Pope Francis's modesty leaves a strong impression on many Indonesians during his visit – highlighting a stark contrast to the lavish lifestyle often displayed by the country's officials and public figures.

title.children: As the pope visited Indonesia, the manner of his arrival drew as much attention as his words

image.altText: A poster of Israeli hostage Eliya Cohen smiling with the words 'Bring him home now' is sticky taped to a wall with graffiti

props.synopsis: As the bodies of six Israeli hostages are recovered from Gaza, questions surround the status of those who remain captive nearly a year since the October 7 attack.

title.children: What we know about the remaining Hamas hostages

image.altText: Donald Trump and Kamala Harris speak into microphones in two side-by-side images.

props.synopsis: After plenty of haggling, the Donald Trump and Kamala Harris camps have agreed to some rules for the first presidential debate. But neither side is entirely happy.

title.children: The Trump-Harris debate rules have been released, and both sides are complaining

image.altText: Man, left, walks out of court wearing a suit with blonde-haired woman on right

props.synopsis: Judge Mark Scarsi tells Hunter Biden he faces up to 17 years in prison and up to $US450,000 in penalties.

title.children: Hunter Biden pleads guilty in federal tax case

image.altText: A man with short black hair looks neutrally at the camera alongside a woman with straight black hair talking behind a microphone

props.synopsis: Indonesia has already sent Alice Guo to the Philippines, with officials saying the negotiation over sending Gregor Haas on drug trafficking charges is ongoing.

title.children: Father of NRL star accused of drug trafficking could be sent to Indonesia in exchange for accused Chinese spy

image.altText: Patchy snow slope with mounds of dirt dotted through it

props.synopsis: Tourism operators and the broader Snowy Mountains region are looking to summer tourism options as they face the prospect of warmer winters and shorter ski seasons.

title.children: This year's ski season ended far earlier than usual, prompting soul-searching among operators

image.altText: A couple hold hands with a child with the family court building in the background.

props.synopsis: Family violence perpetrators are routinely granted time with their children during custody proceedings, but a world-renowned expert hopes to change the culture of "mother blaming" he says has permeated the agencies dealing with family violence.

title.children: 'We need to have higher expectations for men as parents': Family violence expert reveals the myths and biases that unravel family court cases

image.altText: A dozen King Island Dairy double brie cheese wheels splayed with their labels showing.

props.synopsis: The iconic King Island Dairy will close after more than 120 years of operations following dairy giant Saputo's failure to attract a buyer for the business.

title.children: King Island Dairy to shut, ending iconic Australian cheese brand

image.altText: Liam Gallagher leans with an arm slung over his brother Noel's shoulder.

props.synopsis: Uber, Qantas, Virgin and more all use price surging to help their ticket prices match demand. It's a completely legal practice, and Live Nation says it plans to roll it out for concert tickets here in Australia.

title.children: Thanks to Oasis, dynamic pricing has come under fresh scrutiny in the UK. Live Nation says Australia is next

image.altText: Soldiers walk past a destroyed Russian tank and armoured vehicles on a deserted street.

props.synopsis: Five Russian military intelligence officers have been accused of disrupting defence systems and leaking the personal data of thousands of Ukrainians in the lead-up to Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

title.children: Russian intelligence charged by US over cyber attacks on Ukraine

props.synopsis: NDIS & Government Services Minister Bill Shorten says he 'has a few regrets' but maintains that there was 'a lot of disunity' within the Labor party at the time.

title.children: WATCH: Bill Shorten says he 'has a few regrets' in his career following his retiring from politics

image.altText: Two women look at a share price board outside the ASX in Sydney.

props.synopsis: Australian shares are set to open flat, after mixed results on Wall Street. Tesla pushed up the tech-heavy Nasdaq, while jobs data in the US will have major implications for interest rates. Follow the day's events and insights on the live markets blog.

title.children: Tesla's self-driving cars push up Nasdaq, while investors await all-important US jobs data

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Financial toll deepending as RBA warns rates will stay high
Why the US payroll data has big implications for rates

image.altText: Mitch Duke holds his hands to his face

props.synopsis: A 10-man Socceroos outfit has suffered a shock 1-0 loss to Bahrain on the Gold Coast in a disastrous setback to their hopes of direct World Cup qualification.

title.children: Bahrain mark maiden win over Australia as Socceroos suffer shock World Cup qualifier loss

image.altText: Rebecca Cheptegei running on a road, with a crowd of onlookers lining the footpath.

props.synopsis: Ugandan Olympic marathon runner Rebecca Cheptegei has died, days after she was doused in petrol and set on fire by her boyfriend.

title.children: Ugandan Olympic marathon runner Rebecca Cheptegei dies after attack from partner

image.altText: A composite photo of a King Charles, a Beluga whale and Bill Shorten

props.synopsis: Think you can beat this week's news quiz? Test yourself!

title.children: Weekly news quiz: A royal feud, Bill Shorten retires, and a Russian spy-whale's legacy

image.altText: A Liberal Party corflute at a polling booth

props.synopsis: Liberals have had to bring in the big guns to deal with the party's hot mess.

title.children: Dutton tries to fix the Liberals' hot mess — but not without first making it worse

image.altText: A woman with short blond hair sitting at a table with her chin resting on her hand

props.synopsis: After Marilyn Anstiss had a fall and waited eight hours for an ambulance, she got to hospital late at night and remained ramped outside until early the next morning — much like more than 40 per cent of other Queensland patients.

title.children: The ramping crisis meant Marilyn waited 11 hours to get to hospital and onto a bed

image.altText: An image of six brightly decorated donuts positioned on a pink and blue background.

props.synopsis: Sugar is a relatively new addition to our diet. Like many of the world's resources, the discovery and widespread uptake of sugar led to the exploitation of millions of people.

title.children: Got a sweet-tooth craving? The sugar in your biscuits and cakes has a sordid history

image.altText: A black and white scanning electron microscope image showing half a kidney stone with lots of craggles and unevenness

props.synopsis: Kidney stones are an annoying, painful condition that affects many of us, but it's not easy to tell when they form. A scientist who carbon dates objects for a living decided to work out the age of his kidney stone.

title.children: 'Please save it for me': Scientist carbon dates his own kidney stone to find out when it formed

image.altText: Beetlejuice Beetlejuice reunites three generations of Deetz women

props.synopsis: It’s been a long journey for the sequel of Tim Burton’s classic ghostly comedy but it’s finally showtime.

title.children: After 36 years, the Beetlejuice sequel has arrived. Here’s what you need to know
